a member of a women's religious order (as of nuns or deaconesses)

definition: a daughter of your parents. A son of your parents is called your brother
Adjectives
sister
: big, elder, eldest, older
: little, younger
a female nurse in charge of a hospital ward  (=a room for people who are ill in a hospital)
used for talking to a sister in a hospital
a nun  (=a woman who is a member of a religious community)
used in front of the first name of a nun, when talking to her or about her
an organization or group that has close connections with another similar organization or group
used by African American women for talking to or referring to other African American women
used by women for referring to a woman who they have strong feelings of loyalty and friendship towards
in: He has two brothers and two sisters.
big/little sister  (=an older or younger sister): She has to babysit for her little sister tonight.
She was placed in the care of her Aunt Jessie, her father’s elder sister.
I needed to stay strong for the sake of my younger sister.
My leg is still hurting me, Sister.
support for our sisters in the armed forces

definition: a girl or woman who has the same parents as another person:
a girl or woman who treats you in the kind way that a sister would:
a woman who shares an interest with you, especially that of improving women's rights:
used to address a woman:
a female member of a religious group, especially a nun:
a female nurse who is in charge of a department of a hospital:
belonging to a pair or group of similar and related things, such as businesses, usually owned or operated by the same person or organization:
a female who has the same parents as another person:
A sister is also a woman who is a member of the same race, church, religious group, or organization as others:
Sister may be used as a form of address to a woman.
used to describe one of the organizations or companies in a pair or group of similar organizations when referring to it in relation to the others:
in: Lynn's such a good friend - she's like a sister to me.
The sister told us that visiting hours were over.
Excuse me, Sister, could I have some water?
